column4: can you help my with a alsa problem? my soundcard worked perfect, but after a hangup while a reboot it crackles extremly
adjust the volume settings
it has nothing to do with the gain
how have you concluded that?
because its the same volume it was bevore, i have a moto interface which runns stand alone and has a VU-meter on it and its exactlich -0,5 dB peak
are you using only native alsa (no pulseaudio)?
in the alsa mixer i've choosed HDA NVidia (alsa mixer) but there 5 to choose 3 of them are pulseaudio
if its help its the standard ubuntu jaunty settings
what ui are you looking at?
ui?
gnome
meaning, are you using the gnome volume control applet, the sound preferences, or alsamixer in a terminal?
i think its the gnome volume control i use a standard setup from debian jaunty with the standard mixer in the upper bar
i tried alsaconfig but i get command not found, but alsa-utils is installed
we don't ship alsaconf. it's broken.
oh ok
also, if you use the gnome sound preferences, make sure they're set to Autodetect
i have all on autodetect, it worked bevore i did an reboot where ubuntu hang up, now it i got a crackle if i play something
please use "ubuntu-bug pulseaudio"
i will send you the only one errors i got if i enter sudo alsa force-reload
how do i use it?
just type that command
i did
